Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-
6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/4/25, a youth was stabbed in the head and left forearm with
a pen by another youth. Youth involved were taken to the hospital.
Another youth was also transported to the hospital for unknown
reasons. It is unknown if a safety plan was completed. It's
unknown where the youth received the pen from. All 3 youth were
discharged from the hospital on the same day.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 7, 2025,
and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Youth A said
on May 4, 2025, she was in the shower and heard yelling and
exited the shower and saw her peers arguing through the door to
peers on the opposite wing. Youth A said she told the youth to
“calm down” and “stop fighting” to which Youth E responded,
“bitch who you talking to”. Youth A said she told Youth E she was
going to “beat her ass”. Youth A said Staff 2 opened the door that
is between the units and Youth A, and Youth E got into a physical
altercation. Youth A said she felt Youth E stabbing her with
something and she screamed and dropped to the ground. Youth A
said once she fell to the ground everyone stopped fighting, and
the police arrived. Youth A said she was transported to the
hospital and treated and released back to the facility. Youth A said
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Supervisor were trying to stop the
youth from fighting both verbally redirecting them and trying to
physically separate the youth. Youth A said once she returned
from the hospital, she was kept on a separate wing than Youth E.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B said she
was upset because Staff 4 was not working her unit due to Youth
E. Youth B said she asked Youth E what she did to Staff 4 to
make her not want to work their unit and Youth E responded, “go
on with yourself”. Youth B said she then made a phone call to her
2

mother and when she was going to hand the phone back to Staff
1, Youth E tried to grab the phone, but Staff 1 stopped her from
getting the phone which made Youth E upset. Youth B said Youth
E went in her room and grabbed a pencil and threatened to stab
Staff 1. Youth B said she and Staff 1 left the unit briefly and when
they returned, they sat on the couch talking. Youth B said Youth E
pulled her pant legs up and put her hood over her head like she
was getting ready to fight. Youth B said Youth E began to tell
Youth B to “go somewhere” and then passed a note to Youth D
about Youth E. Youth B said Youth E was arguing back and forth
with Staff 1 until Supervisor arrived at the unit and told Youth B to
leave. Youth B said she went to the adjoining unit and could hear
and see Youth E assaulting Staff 3 and attempting to get into
Youth B’s room. Youth B said she got upset and was yelling
through the door at Youth E. Youth B said Youth A came out of
the bathroom and walked over to Youth E who punched Youth A.
Youth B said Youth D jumped into the fight and was assaulting
Youth A as well. Youth B said Staff 2 opened the door to assist
Staff 3 in stopping the fight and as Staff 2 was shutting the door
behind her Youth B got her hand pinched in the door and then
pushed it open and ran through and “jumped in the fight”. Youth B
said she saw blood on Youth A’s arm and felt “woozy” and fell
down. Youth B said Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Supervisor were
all telling the youth to stop fighting and were trying to physically
separate the youth. Youth B said the police arrived and she was
brought to the hospital for an exam due to her hand being pinched
in the door accidently by Staff 2. Youth B said she returned from
the hospital after a few hours and was kept on a different unit than
Youth E.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D said Youth
B and Youth E were arguing and “about to fight” so staff moved
Youth B to a different unit. Youth D said Youth B was able to see
Youth E through the window of the door that is between the units
and was arguing with Youth E through the window. Youth D said
Youth E told her that she thought Youth B and Youth A were going
to “jump her” and Youth A got mad that she was talking to Youth E
and started to yell as well. Youth D said Staff 2 opened the door
between the units and Youth A and Youth B ran in and began to
fight her. Youth D said Youth A and Youth B then ran over to
Youth E and began to fight her however Youth E had a pen and
started to stab Youth A in the arm. Youth D said Youth A began to
bleed which triggered her, so a staff brought her off the unit. Youth
D said Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Supervisor were all intervening
3

and stopping the fight. Youth D said staff were “doing the best
they could” in the situation.
Youth E was not able to be interviewed. On May 7, 2025, an
attempt was made to interview Youth E however she was not at
the facility. On May 22, 2025, an attempt was made to interview
Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and refused to
be interviewed. On May 27, 2025, an attempt was made to
interview Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and
refused to be interviewed.
Supervisor was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor said May 4,
2025, was the first time he had worked at Rose Hall and had
limited knowledge about the youth. Supervisor said there was
tension between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E so they moved
Youth B to a different unit. Supervisor said he informed staff not to
open the doors between the units. Supervisor said he was in his
office and saw on camera the staff opening the adjoining doors
and Youth B rushing towards Youth E and begin to fight.
Supervisor said the staff on the units began to break up the fight
and he ran down to the unit to assist. Supervisor said he and the
other staff were able to get the youth separated and realized
Youth A was injured. Supervisor said Youth A refused to see a
facility nurse however the police and ambulance had responded
due to staff calling 911 during the incident and Youth A willingly
went to the hospital to be examined. Supervisor said Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth E all went to the hospital at 1:45pm and
returned later that afternoon. Supervisor said Youth A and Youth
B were kept on a different unit than Youth E for the remainder of
the shift however he was unsure of any safety plan in place after
that shift.
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said Youth E was
upset on May 4, 2025, because she wanted to make a phone call
and Staff 1 asked her to wait due to her dealing with another
youth. Staff 1 said Youth E then began to stab a pen at her and
Staff 3 told her to go to the other unit. Staff 1 said she went to the
unit with Youth A and Youth B and saw Youth E attacking Staff 3
through the door window. Staff 1 said Staff 2 opened the door to
run and help Staff 3. Staff 1 said once the door was opened
between the units Youth A and Youth B ran through and began to
attached Youth D and Youth E. Staff 1 said Youth E was swinging
wildly and stabbed Youth A several times with a pen. Staff 1 said
Staff 3 was attempting to hold back Youth A from hitting Youth E
4

which then allowed Youth E to stab Youth A with a pen two
additional times before they got Youth E away from Youth A. Staff
1 said Youth E ran to her room and she stood in front of the door
so that the other youth could not enter Youth E’s bedroom. Staff 1
said Supervisor arrived but did not do anything to assist Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Staff 3 in breaking up the fight. Staff 1 said the police
had been contacted during this incident by someone and arrived
and Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E were taken to the hospital for
evaluations and returned later that evening and were placed on
separate units.
Staff 2 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said she was
working on May 4, 2025, when Youth E attacked Staff 1 and Staff
1 moved to work with her on her unit. Staff 2 said Youth E was still
very escalated, so she was checking through the door into the unit
to ensure everything was safe. Staff 2 said Youth E and Youth D
attempted to go into another youth’s room and Staff 3 stood in
front of the door preventing them access to the youth’s room. Staff
2 said Youth E and Youth D began to attack Staff 3 so she
opened the adjoining door to assist him. Staff 2 said she tried to
close the door behind her however Youth B got her hand in the
door before she could close it and she pinched Youth B’s hand
and then Youth A and Youth B “bust through” behind her. Staff 2
said Staff 1 and Supervisor also responded in to assist in the
situation. Staff 2 said Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E all began
fighting with one another and Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Supervisor were trying to separate the youth and stop the fight.
Staff 2 said Youth E had a pen and began to stab Youth A in the
head and side. Staff 2 said someone had called the police and
once they arrived, they were able to take Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth E to the hospital for an evaluation. Staff 2 said Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth E returned from the hospital around 4:45pm
and were kept on separate units the remainder of the evening.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2025. Staff 3
said he was working with Youth D and Youth E with one other
staff, whom he could not remember. Staff 3 said Youth D and
Youth E had been going back and forth with Youth A and Youth B
through the adjoining doorway window all morning. Staff 3 said
Youth D and Youth E started to talk about running away and
began to attempt to grab his keys and get into a room for
additional clothing to leave. Staff 3 said he stood in front of the
door and would not allow Youth D and Youth E to get his keys,
and they began to push him and then started to punch him
repeatedly. Staff 3 said he put his hands up and blocked the
5

punches and called a “clear” for additional assistance. Staff 3 said
additional staff responded to assist and when they opened the
door from their unit Youth A and Youth B pushed through and got
onto the unit with Youth D and Youth E. Staff 3 said Youth A and
Youth B immediately ran up to Youth D and Youth E and began to
fight with them. Staff 3 said he and the other staff stood in-
between the youth and were verbally redirecting the behaviors.
Staff 3 said Youth A began to have a panic or asthma attack and
all the youth stopped fighting at that point. Staff 3 said the police
and ambulance arrived and took Youth A and Youth B to the
hospital for an evaluation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of May 4, 2025, unit milieu was reviewed on
May 6, 2025. Youth E is seen sitting in a chair, Youth D is seen
sitting on a desk, Staff 3 is standing in front of a bedroom door.
Youth E and Youth D are seen looking through the doorway
window where someone is looking through the window. Youth E
gets up and walks to Staff 3 and begins pushing him and hitting
him. Staff 3 has his hands in front of him deflecting Youth E’s hits.
Youth D runs over and is also hitting and pushing Staff 3 who has
his hands outstretched in front of him and his back to the bedroom
door. Staff 2 is seen coming through the adjoining door with Youth
A and Youth B pushing her and coming through as well. Youth A
and Youth B run past Staff 2 and begin fighting Youth D and
Youth E with Staff 3 in the middle of the youth. Staff 2 and Staff 3
run in and also position themselves standing between youth.
Youth A, Youth B, Youth D, and Youth E move around the staff
and are punching and kicking at each other and staff. Staff 1, Staff
2, and Staff 3 all move with the youth and continually try to get in-
between them. Youth D is seen going into a room, while Youth A,
Youth B, Youth E, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 all move down the
hallway with the youth still punching and kicking. After several
minutes Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E are seen separating and
walking down the hallway. Youth A and Youth E are then seen
running back at each other fighting with staff positioning
themselves between the youth. Youth A and Youth B run to the
room Youth D is in and attempt to get into the room however Staff
1 is standing in front of the door preventing them from entering the
room. Youth E is no longer on the unit and Youth A and Youth B
are seen pacing the unit trying to get into Youth D’s room while
Staff 1 stands in front of the door. Staff 2 and Supervisor are each
walking near Youth A and Youth B throughout the unit. This
behavior continues for ten minutes prior to Youth A and Youth B
leaving the unit with Staff 1 and Staff 2.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s After Visit Summary from Garden City Hospital
dated May 4, 2025. The document reported the reason for
visit being “head injury” and diagnoses being “forearm
laceration, left, initial encounter and abrasion of skin of
head”.
• Vista Maria Incident Report dated May 4, 2025, for the
incident with Youth A, Youth B, Youth D, and Youth F. The
incident report is consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Vista Maria “Youth Special Plan for Separation and Safety”
was reviewed for Youth A and Youth E, dated May 4, 2025.
The plan outlines the directions to keep Youth A and Youth
E apart while in the building as well as at school or outside
of the building.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, the staff responded appropriately to
the incident and intervened in the physical altercation to stop the
youth and sought out appropriate treatment for the youth
afterwards.
As noted above, Law Enforcement was contacted on May 4, 2025,
and had contact with multiple youth. The agency did not notify
licensing as required. This is being addressed under Special
Investigation 2025SIC0000708.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149 Resident nutrition.
Section (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible meals
Description daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/5/25, one youth was not provided food until 5:30pm.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 7, 2025,
and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Youth A said
she has never gone without a meal while placed at the facility.
Youth A said on the weekends the youth are provided a hot
breakfast around 10am, lunch around 1pm, and dinner around
5:30pm. Youth A said on May 4, 2025, she was provided
breakfast sandwiches, fruit, and orange juice at 11am, then did
7

not eat until she returned from the hospital around 5pm and was
also given pizza later that evening.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B said she
has always been provided breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks at
the facility. Youth B said on May 4, 2025, she was given a
breakfast sandwich, hashbrowns, and cereal at 10am, taco
casserole at 5pm after she returned from the hospital, and pizza at
7pm.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Youth C said
she is normally provided breakfast at 11am, lunch at 1pm, and
dinner at 6pm on weekends. Youth C said on May 4, 2025, she
was given a chicken sandwich and hashbrowns at 10am, taco
tater-tot casserole and salad at 5:45pm, Fritos as a snack at 6pm,
Bosco sticks and salad at 6:15pm, and pizza at 8:30pm. Youth C
said there was not enough staff working to make them lunch at
1pm due to all the staff responding to the fight between Youth A
and Youth E. Youth C said this is the only time she has not been
provided meals on the regular schedule.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D said she is
provided breakfast, lunch, and dinner each day. Youth D said on
May 4, 2025, she was given breakfast at 11am and lunch around
3pm. Youth D said the staff were busy dealing with her, Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth E so could not prepare the lunch and feed
everyone at 1pm.
Youth E was not able to be interviewed. On May 7, 2025, an
attempt was made to interview Youth E however she was not at
the facility. On May 22, 2025, an attempt was made to interview
Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and refused to
be interviewed. On May 27, 2025, an attempt was made to
interview Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and
refused to be interviewed.
Supervisor was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor said meals for
the youth come from the central kitchen. Supervisor said on
weekends the kitchen staff call over to the units and they go and
pick up their breakfast and lunch together and later in the day will
pick up dinner. Supervisor said the youth are provided a hot, large
breakfast on weekends between 10am and 10:30am, then lunch
8

around 12pm-1pm, with dinner being served between 5pm-6pm.
Supervisor said on May 4, 2025, the breakfast and lunch was
picked up by staff and the youth were provided breakfast around
10:30am. Supervisor said he planned to order the youth pizza for
lunch however then the situation with Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth E fighting occurred and all staff were either on their units or
assisting in the incident so pizza was not ordered and the staff did
not get a chance to heat and serve the lunch until sometime
between 3pm and 4pm. Supervisor said the youth were then given
lunch between 4pm and 5pm and he also ordered pizza which
arrived between 5pm and 6pm. Supervisor said May 4, 2025, was
not the normal routine and he has never had an incident occur
that has pushed back the youth’s mealtimes previously.
Supervisor said the youth did get plenty to eat that day just on a
different schedule than they are used to.
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said on weekends
the youth are typically provided breakfast between 10:30am and
11am, lunch between 12pm and 1pm, and dinner between 4:30pm
and 5pm. Staff 1 said on May 4, 2025, the youth were provided
breakfast at 11am. Staff 1 said her shift ended at 3:15pm and the
youth had not yet gotten their lunch due to Supervisor telling them
they were getting pizza and it not being delivered yet. Staff 1 said
this was the first time she has seen a meal provided outside of the
normal schedule. Staff 1 denied any youth complaining or asking
for food.
Staff 2 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said on weekends
the youth are normally provided breakfast between 10:30am and
11am, lunch between 12pm and 12:30pm, and dinner between
5pm and 5:30pm. Staff 2 said the staff normally pick up breakfast,
lunch, and snacks all in the morning and then will warm up the
meals at the specific times. Staff 2 said on May 4, 2025, the youth
were provided breakfast between 10:30am and 11am, then lunch
and dinner foods at the same time between 5pm and 5:30pm, and
then pizza at 9pm. Staff 2 said none of the youth complained to
her about being hungry that day however it was an unusual
situation for lunch to be so delayed. Staff 2 said this was the only
time she has ever worked that the food schedule was delayed.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2025. Staff 3
said the youth were all provided breakfast, lunch, and dinner that
day however he could not recall the exact times they were served
the meals.
9

Documents Reviewed:
• Vista Maria menus from March 2, 2025, through May 24,
2025, were reviewed. The menus describe each meal and
snacks provided for the youth. The menus indicate hot
breakfasts for youth on weekends.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, the youth are provided three nutritious edible meals
daily.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section (3) The ratio formula for direct care workers shall correspond with
Description the institution’s purpose and the needs of the residents and shall
assure the continual safety, protection, and direct care and
supervision of residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation On 5/4/2025, one youth was on a one-to-one staffing requirement
that was not followed by staff.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth E was not able to be interviewed. On May 7, 2025, an
attempt was made to interview Youth E however she was not at
the facility. On May 22, 2025, an attempt was made to interview
Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and refused to
be interviewed. On May 27, 2025, an attempt was made to
interview Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and
refused to be interviewed.
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said on May 4, 2025,
Youth E was on a one-to-one staffing plan. Staff 1 said she and
Staff 3 were the staff on Youth E’s unit with her and Youth D. Staff
1 said once Youth E stabbed her with a pen and she left the unit,
Staff 3 was alone with both Youth E and Youth D, leaving Youth E
without a one-to-one staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said she was
working on May 4, 2025, when Youth E attacked Staff 1 and Staff
1 moved to work with her on her unit. Staff 2 said Youth E was on
one-to-one staffing however Staff 3 was left along on the unit with
Youth E and Youth D.
10

Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2025. Staff 3
said he was working with Youth E on May 4, 2025. Staff 3 said
there was one other staff working the unit with him however he
could not remember who it was. Staff 3 said he recalled that staff
member leaving the unit for a short time which was when Youth D
and Youth E began to attack him.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of May 4, 2025, unit milieu was reviewed on
May 6, 2025. Youth D and Youth E are seen on a unit with Staff 3.
There are no other youth or staff present on the unit.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth E’s one-to-one billing record was reviewed. Youth E
was on “1:1 Supervision” starting on February 26, 2025,
with no end date as of May 19, 2025.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff interviews,
video review, and documentation, Youth E was on 1:1 supervision
however the agency did not follow this plan and left one staff with
two youth on her unit.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2025SIC0000170 dated 2/7/2025, CAP Approved 2/25/2025
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
